councilStructure: City Commission with 6 commissioners elected at-large city-wide for 4-year terms, plus Mayor elected at-large for 2-year terms (total 7 members)
notes: Auburn uses a City Commission structure (not City Council). Non-partisan elections, nominated by petition. The Commission represents all citizens and has responsibility for setting municipal policies. November 2024 election confirmed at-large structure with voters choosing 3 candidates from 5 nominees.

councilStructure: Three wards (Ward 1, Ward 2, Ward 3) with one council member from each ward. Council members must live in their ward but are elected at-large by all city voters. Mayor and Vice-Mayor positions rotate among the three councilmembers.
notes: Hybrid structure: ward residency requirements with at-large elections. ACOG (Association of Central Oklahoma Governments) maintains GIS data for council ward boundaries updated as of 2020. Council members serve 3-year terms in nonpartisan elections.

councilStructure: Pennsylvania third-class borough with 7-member council elected at-large (typical PA borough structure). No wards identified. Council members serve 4-year terms.
notes: Trafford Borough follows Pennsylvania Borough Code which specifies councils of 3, 5, 7, or 9 members (typically 7). In boroughs not divided into wards, all officers are elected at-large by voters of entire borough. 2025 election documents confirm at-large council elections with candidates running borough-wide. Borough straddles Westmoreland and Allegheny counties.

councilStructure: Five council districts with one council member from each district. New district map adopted February 27, 2024.
notes: Morgan City adopted new council district boundaries on February 27, 2024. District plan PDF (Plan 1 rev E) shows 5 districts with population breakdowns. City population 11,472. GIS endpoint is a PDF map showing district boundaries with street references (FIG ST, RAILROAD AVE, 6TH ST, FRONT ST, etc.). Located in St. Mary Parish (distinct from parish-level government which has 11 districts).

councilStructure: Six ward-based council members (Wards 1-6) elected by voters in each respective ward, plus Mayor elected at-large. Council members must reside in their ward for at least 6 months prior to election.
notes: Bedford uses strict ward-based elections where each council member is elected only by voters of their ward (not at-large). Mayor serves as Council President and oversees all 6 wards as at-large position. All serve 4-year terms. City underwent ward redistricting in 2022 (Ordinance 9964-22) to ensure wards are nearly equal in population. Cuyahoga County Board of Elections and City GIS page provide ward boundary maps.
